Bake in the preheated oven until the vegetables are lightly golden and tender, or about 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.

Preheat oven to 400f. Coat 12 cup muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray. Mix carrot, egg, cheese, and chives. Add flour and baking powder, stir. Spoon batter equally among muffin cups. Bake 25-30 minutes until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees c. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks to cool.

In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onions and peppers until onions soften. Add corned beef. Continue to cook until cubes fall apart. Add frozen hash browns. Add seasoning if desired. Cook, stirring often until potatoes are done and start to brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place tomatoes and peppers, cut side down on a baking rack set onto a baking sheet. Roast for 20-30 minutes or until skins are easily removed. Spray or brush vegetables with olive oil and continue to roast until tomatoes become a dark red color, about 2 hours. Remove from oven and chop into small pieces. Meanwhile, cook and drain pasta. Place into a mixing bowl. Add the onions, tomatoes and peppers, toss to combine. Mix together the vinegar, mustard, parsley, basil, olive oil, salt and pepper. Beat with a whisk to combine. Pour over the pasta, add the cheese and toss again. Pour over

Preheat the oven to 375f. Butter a round, 2-quart baking dish and pour in the fruit. Mix the granulated sugar, baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. Beat the egg with the vanilla and add it to the granulated sugar mixture. Mix well with a fork or finger. Sprinkle the topping evenly over the fruit and pour the butter evenly over it. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until the top is lightly brown. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs until well beaten and slightly frothy. Whisk in milk, chives and black pepper. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat olive oil or butter over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add egg mixture to skillet and then quickly arrange remaining ingredients on top of eggs. Cook for 3 minutes on the stovetop without stirring. Transfer to oven. Bake until the top is golden brown and the frittata is set, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork, garlic, salt, soy sauce, oyster sauce, water, raw shrimp, cornstarch, eggs, green onions and stir-fry sauce mixture to vegetables in skillet and cook 4 to 5 minutes or just until pork turn opaque throughout, stirring occasionally. To serve, spoon rice onto plates and top with shrimp mixture.

Place the chicken in crock pot and sprinkle with garlic powder, onion powder and pepper. Top with soup. Cover and cook until chicken juices run clear. Stir in cheese and olives. Cover and cook until cheese is melted. Meanwhile, cook fettuccine according to package directions and drain. Serve chicken on top of fettuccine.
Place roast and onion in crock pot sprayed with pam. Add bay leaf, soy sauce and garlic powder. Cover. Cook on high 1 hour and then low 6 hours. Slice and serve.

Place pork in crock pot. Pour can of beef broth over pork. Cook for about 10 hours or until meat shreds easily. Remove pork and shred with two forks. Stir the meat with barbecue sauce in a hot skillet on the stove and serve on hamburger buns.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place marinated pork in a roasting pan, and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees f, basting meat often with marinade. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. To serve, slice thinly and garnish with green onions.

In a saucepan, bring water to a boil, add peas and. Cook 5 minutes or until peas are tender, drain, reserve the cooking water. Puree the peas in your food processor add 5 tbsp of the reserved water and the butter return to saucepan and stir in the orange peel& rosemary heat through. Meanwhile immerse the peas in boiling water and blanch for apprx 5 minutes or until the peas are tender, drain, reserve the cooking water. Meanwhile immerse the peas in boiling water and bl

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in green chilies and red bell pepper. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

Place pasta mixture in a large bowl. Add pasta. Cook 8 minutes. Add shrimp to pot. Cook 3 minutes or until shrimp are done and pasta is al dente. Drain. Place pasta mixture in a large bowl. Stir in basil and next 4 ingredients. Place spinach on plates. Top with pasta mixture.

Put noodles in 4 cups of salted boiling water. Cook 1-2 minutes. Stir occasionally. Drain and dry. Heat oil in wok or frypan until smoking hot. Add ginger and onion stir for 30 seconds. Add noodles and fry for 5 minutes over med heat. Add sauce, and stir until coated. Serve hot or cold. Sometimes i add some julienned carrots or broccoli to this.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook until the fish is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2 minutes more. Reduce heat to medium, turn the fish over, stir the soy mixture and pour into the pan. Bring the sauce to a boil and cook until the fish is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 2 minutes more. Add scallions and remove from the heat. Serve the fish drizzled with the sauce.

In a large skillet heat the oil over med-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink then add the garlic and cook until the chicken has browned to desired doneness. Add the reserved marinade, broth and wine. And if using the dried oregano. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Stir in the artichokes and olives. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes. Add the hot cooked pasta and simmer for 10 minutes or until sauce is absorbed. Serve with the crumbled feta cheese. Great with a salad.

Combine all ingredients except pasta in small sauce pan. Cook on high heat until bubbly, stirring often. Turn down heat and cover. Simmer at least 30 minutes for best flavor. Cook pasta according to package directions. Sauce may be thinned with water reserved from pasta if desired. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in a large saute or fry pan until very hot. Add vegetables all at once, spreading in an even layer. Do not stir until bottom of layer begins to brown. The trick here is to keep heat high and brown pieces without overcooking or burning them. If pieces are browned, but not soft enough for your taste, turn off heat and cover pan for a few minutes.

In a large bowl, combine condensed milk, egg whites, granulated sugar, peppermint oil, green food coloring, mini chocolate chips. Blend well. Gradually fold in whipped cream. Add chocolate chips and mix well. Pour into a 9x5-inch freezer container. Cover and freeze at least 6 hours.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place pork chops in roasting pan and cook for 20 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add eggs, water, flour, salt, pepper, cheese, olive oil and cook for about 5 minutes, until the omelette is set and the bottom is golden brown. Slide the omelette back into the pan, cover, lower the heat, and cook for about 5 minutes longer, until the omelette is set and the bottom is golden brown. Slide the omelette back into the pan, cover, lower the heat, and cook for about 5 minutes

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Using a baking sheet with a lip, melt butter. Mix seasoning into the butter, and then toss in almonds. Bake in a 350 oven for about 10-12 minutes, stirring once, until nuts are lightly toasted and fragrant. Remove from heat and serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine brown mustard seeds, yellow mustard seeds, dark beer, white wine vinegar, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder, sugar, salt, allspice, turmeric, mace, mustard powder

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste.

In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and sugar. Temper small amounts of the tapioca into the egg mixture until you have added at least 1 cup. Add this back into the remaining tapioca in the slow cooker. Add the lemon zest and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 15 minutes, stirring at least once. Transfer the pudding to a bowl and cover the surface with plastic wrap. Allow to cool at room temperature for 1 hour and then place in the refrigerator until thoroughly chilled.

In a large saucepan, add the ground beef, onion, garlic, dried italian herb seasoning, stewed tomatoes, beef broth, frozen mixed vegetables, conchiglie, parsley, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, add the water-mixed beef broth or beef cube and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer, partially covered for 15 minutes so the flavors can blend. Add the vegetables and conchiglie. Simmer uncovered over medium heat until they are tender, maybe 10 minutes. Season the soup with salt and pepper and stir in the parsley.
Mix together mustard, syrup, onion and orange peel. Set aside. Roast pork at 350 degrees for 20-25 mins per side. Roast pork at

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in green chilies and red bell pepper. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes
Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease bottom and side of a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle oktoberfest on top and serve warm.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with oil. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic powder, milk, tomatoes, black olives, sharp cheddar cheese, salt and pepper. Place pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic powder, milk,

Preheat oven to 350f. In small saucepan, melt chocolate chips and margarine over low heat, stirring until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Place vegetables in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over vegetables. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange sweet potatoes in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Combine maple syrup, butter, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the sweet potatoes. Toss to coat. Cover and bake the sweet potatoes for 15 minutes. Uncover, stir and cook, stirring every 15 minutes, until tender and starting to turn brown, 45 to 50 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Flour pizza dough and roll out to 12 inches in diameter. Spread pesto on dough with the back of a spoon. Spread ricotta on top of pesto. Lay strips of proscuitto on top of ricotta. Cover the proscuitto with mozarella. Sprinkle parmesan on top. Bake at 450 for 10-15 minutes or until very golden. Let cool 3-5 minutes before slicing.

Melt gelatin powder, sugar, hot water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix, cold water, powdered drink mix,

Combine all ingredients except the meat in a medium bowl. Place the meat in a shallow glass or ceramic dish in one layer. Pour marinade over and turn meat to coat well. Marinate at room temperature for at least 2 hours. Drain meat. Thread on 6 skewers and grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning to cook all sides.

Heat a large saucepan over a low heat and add the mushrooms. When the butter has melted, add the onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper to taste, then increase the heat and stir. When the moisture from the mushrooms has been released, allow it to evaporate, concentrating the flavour. This might happen quickly or slowly, depending entirely on the type of mushrooms used. Add teh paprika and cayenne and fry for a few moments longer, until the paprika turns a shade darker. Finally, add teh sour cream or creme fraiche and dill, and allow it to bubbvle gently for a further 5 minutes or so.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake for about 15 minutes or until middle feels set and not jiggly. Remove from oven and in small mixing bowl combine oatmeal with remaining ingredients. Press into 9-inch pie plate. Fill with desired filling and bake or bake crust empty for later use.

Season both sides of the chicken thighs with salt and pepper. In a large nonstick skillet with a lid, heat the oil over high heat. Add the chicken thighs and cook until well browned, about 2 minutes per side. Add the tomatoes, orange juice, garlic and capers. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover the pan and cook for 8 minutes. Uncover the pan and continue cooking, turning the thighs once, until the chicken is no longer pink in the middle and the sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, thyme, garlic, salt, pepper and brown sugar. Cut the tomatoes in half and toss to combine with the olive oil mixture. Spread the tomatoes in a roasting pan and place in the oven. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until the tomatoes are shrivelled. Break the ends from the asparagus at their natural breaking point. Add the tender lengths of asparagus to the tomatoes and continue to cook for 25 minutes or until the asparagus is tender.

In saute pan, saute garlic with oil until brown. Add broccoli and tomatoes and stir. Cool for 1 minute, then add wine and broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat. Cover and cook 20 - 25 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese.

Cook potatoes until tender. While potatoes are cooking, combine olive oil, rice wine vinegar, wine if using, mustard, salt and pepper in large mixing bowl. Whisk well. When potatoes are tender peel or not. Dice potatoes. Add to dressing. Add the onions, parsley and herbs, and toss all gently to combine. Serve warm. Leftovers can be served cold, or reheated gently in microwave.

Place all ingredients in a large pan, stir. Turn down heat and simmer uncovered until thickened. This may take up to an hour. Cool slightly, spoon into jars. Close jars, cool completely, then keep refrigerated.
Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium high heat. Add chicken. Cook and stir until lightly browned. Add remaining ingredients. Cook and stir about 10 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a 15 x 10-inch jellyroll pan. Cream butter with sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add peanut butter and beat until combined well. Beat in egg, vanilla and salt. Add flour and beat until combined. Stir in coconut. Spread mixture evenly in prepared pan. Sprinkle peanuts over, pressing them in lightly. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a tester comes out clean. Let cool, cut into 24 bars and then the bar on the diagonal, making 48 cookies.
Cook on high 4 hours, or on low for 8 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

In a small saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add lemon juice, concentrates and extract. Cover and freeze. Remove from freezer 1-2 hours before serving. Just before serving, mash the mixture with a potato masher and stir in lemon-lime soda.

Heat oil in cast iron skillet until it reaches 350 or flour bubbles immediately upon being sprinkled in it. Place the soy sauce, vinegar and oil in a screw-top jar and shake until well combined. Place the oysters on a large serving platter. Drizzle over the soy and sesame dressing. Sprinkle with the green shallots. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook garlic until tender and fragrant but not browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and mix well. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat and simmer gently for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Place tortilla in crockpot. Cover with lid and cook for about 10 hours or until tortilla is tender. Remove tortilla from crockpot and serve.

Mix sugar and water in a small saucepan. Stir in water. Place over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook 2 minutes of until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in amaretto and lemon juice. Heat just until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in almonds and extract. Serve warm or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, beat the margarine, white sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking powder, salt, chocolate-covered toffee bits, semi-sweet chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Can be frosted with chocolate frosting. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch

Preheat oven to 350f. Pour melted butter into a 9x13-in baking dish. Add chicken, skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic. Turn chicken over, season and lay bacon strips on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove chicken, bacon and mushrooms to a platter and keep warm. Pour sauce over chicken and serve warm.

In a large skillet, saute the chicken in oil until no longer pink. Stir in the soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stin in sour cream. Serve over toasted noodles. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper or paprika.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin tins with cooking spray. In a large bowl, mix together flour, bran flakes, baking soda, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl, combine applesauce, banana and shredded apple. Add sugar and egg to wet ingredients. Add wet ingredients to flour mixture, stirring just until combined. Fill muffin tins and bake for about 25 minutes or until tests clean.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degree season meat with seasonings. In large skillet over medium high heat, saute the meat until well browned on all sides. Next, place the potatoes, onions, green peppers and mushrooms over the meat. Top with salad dressing, and cover with foil. Bake at 350 degree for 1 hour, or until potatoes are done and meat is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 f degrees. Beat cream cheese, plain sweet biscuits, cheesecake, strawberries, syrup until smooth. Pour into graham cracker pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes or until edges are brown. Turn oven off and let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour. Remove to wire rack to cool. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter an 8-inch square pyrex baking dish. Cover the bottom of the dish generously with the torn bread. Combine the eggs, milk, melted butter, cheese, salt and sugar in a bowl. Mix ntil combined. Stir in the roccoli and pour the mixture over the read. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 35 minutes. For a chewier top, remove the foil during the last 10 to 12 minutes of baking. If you want a crisper crust, run the casserole under the broiler.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Tear 2 pita breads into chip-size pieces and brush with oil. Sprinkle with lime zest and chilli flakes. Bake for 10 mins until crisp. Sprinkle with salt if you like.

Mix all ingredients together in a glass bowl. Place lamb in a extra large heavy-duty plastic bag or glass bowl. Pour the marinade over the lamb, and turn to coat well on all sides. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for a minimum of 24 hours. When ready to grill, remove from fridge and save marinade for basting if desired. Turn the grill to high heat. Sear both sides for about 5 minutes on each side. Reduce grill temperature to medium heat and finish cooking the lamb. You may baste the lamb with the leftover marinade if desired.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine cup water, sugar and lemon zest. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Set aside to cool. Strain syrup through sieve placed over large measuring cup, discarding solids. Whisk in lemon juice and remaining 2 cups water. Pour into molds and freeze until solid, for at least 4 hours. If you are using an ice pop kit, follow the manufacturers instructions.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Place noodles in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over noodles. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion.

Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process just until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful not to overprocess. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months. To make lumumba swiss hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. To make lumumba swiss hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is powdery -- about

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add in onion and saute until golden. Add in sliced cabbage, cider vinegar, sugar, celery seeds and black pepper. Mix to combine and cook until the cabbage if crisp-tender and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Season with salt.

Place artichoke hearts and salt in a saucepan containing about 2 inches of water and bring to a boil. Cook until slightly tender. Pack in pint jars. Place a sliver of lemon and lime in each jar. Combine the oil, juices and garlic in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour immediately over the artichoke hearts and seal. Place caps on jars. Process for 20 mins. In a water bath canner.

In a medium-size, heavy-bottom non-aluminum saucepan, combine cranberries, apples, apple juice, sugar, orange peel, cranberries. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered for 4 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Add cranberries, sugar, juice and cinnamon. Increase the heat to medium, bring to a boil again, then reduce the heat to low. Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Transfer to a bowl, cover and chill.

Heat oven to 350f. Mix all ingredients, except salmon, together. Pour a small amount of the mix into the bottom of a baking pan - just enough to lightly cover the bottom. Add the salmon, and pour the remaining mix over top. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the first six ingredients for crust. Place half of mix in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake crust for 10 minutes. Melt caramels and whipping cream. Place chocolate chips over baked crust, drizzel caramel over chips, then place the remaining crust mixture on top of the caramel. Bake another 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool.

Cook the macaroni until done as usual. Do not overcook it. Drain macaroni in strainer. Place macaroni, butter, salt, pepper, milk, mozzarella cheese, and 3 cups of cheddar cheese in casserole dish. Mix eggs in a bowl first and then stir into mixture. Cover everything with aluminum foil and cook for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Uncover and add extra cup of cheddar cheese across the top. Bake uncovered for another 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 325f. Mix all ingredients except onions and cheese together. Coat 9x11 casserole with nonstick cooking spray. Place the onions in a single layer in the casserole and pour chicken broth mixture evenly over all the onions. Cover onions and bake for 1 hour. After hour, remove and sprinkle with cheese. Return to oven uncovered and bake 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted.

Combine all ingredients in small saucepan over medium heat. Add lemon juice and enough cold water to measure 4 cups total. Fill glasses with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves and fresh lemon slices.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 5-8 minutes. Add the cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, until light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add the stock, milk, nutmeg, and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the cauliflower is easily pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Remove 1 cup of cauliflower florets and set aside., puree soup in blender or food processor until smooth. Return soup to pot and stir in the cheese and remaining cauliflower florets and adjust seasonings to taste.
In a large skillet combine carrots, water, and 1 tablespoon of the butter. Cover and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until carrots

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl until well-blended. Roll peanut butter mixture into tablespoon size balls. Bake 12 minutes for chewy cookies. Bake 15 minutes for crisp.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl stir together margarine and brown sugar. Add egg and beat. Then add baking powder and flour. Mash banana and add chocolate chips if using. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 15 minutes ot until browned.

Steep 1 tea bag, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice, 1 cup of fresh lemon juice,

Heat oil in 2-quart saucepan. Add onion and garlic. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, until onion wilts. Stir in cumin and pepper. Continue to cook for 2-3 minutes. Add oregano, potatoes, green chilies and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and simmer slowly for 45 minutes. Serve hot with cheese sprinkled in the middle of bowl.

Place beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in water chestnuts and seasonings. Heat through. Drain beans and stir into skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients in a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a pan with foil. Wash and slice kale very thin. Mix spices, lemon juice and oil in a separate bowl. Dip in each slice of kale into the kale mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until soft, with crispy edges.

To make the cannoli dip, bring the water to a boil in a small saucepan. Add as much sugar as will dissolve into the water, then add the amaretto and lemon juice. Just before it starts to boil, add the cherries, and stir it over a high heat until the liquid takes on the color of the cherries. Reduce the heat, and simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated. Place the mixture in a small bowl, cover tightly, and place in the fridge. To make the coffee cream, simply combine the cheese, kahlua, and coffee in a bowl, and stir until the mixture is uniform in color. Add sugar to taste, if necessary. Once the cherry sauce has cooled, arrange the three components in layers in a martini glass, with the biscuit crumbs on the bottom, cherry sauce in the middle, and coffee cream on top. Refridgerate until the coffee cream is firm. Decorate with powdered sugar, and place a cherry on top.

Combine long grain and wild rice blend, mayonnaise, sour cream, celery, chicken, salted cashews, lettuce leaf, alfalfa sprout. Add to salad. Toss to evenly coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Line 4 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Top with salad. Line 5 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 6 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 7 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 8 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 9 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 10 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 11 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 12 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 13 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 14 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 15 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 16 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Line 17 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Top

Heat large non-stick skillet, swirl in oil, then add garlic. Saute 30 seconds. Add beef in two batches, cook til just browned, about 2 minutes. Drain pasta, add to bowl with yogurt dressing. Add steak and tomatoes, toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Preheat oven to 350deg. Grease 13x9 inch baking pan. Crust. Beat flour, butter, and brown sugar in small mixer bowl until crumbly. Press into pan, bake for 12-15 min until lightly brown. Filling. Beat eggs, cornsyrup, granulated sugar, butter and vanilla in small mixer bowl with wire wisk. Stir in chunks and nuts. Pour evenly over baked crust. Bake for 25-30 min or until set. Cool completely in pan on wire rack.

Combine all of the ingredients for the sauce in a small bowl. Brush over the chicken. Broil the chicken for 10 minutes each side, 2 inches or so from the heat. Brush frequently with the sauce. Serves 1-2 people.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments.

Drain pineapple, reserving juice. Mix pineapple juice and dry instant vanilla pudding together and set in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Mix the pineapple, fruit cocktail, mandarin oranges, bananas, miniature marshmallows, instant vanilla pudding, cool whippreparation:Drain pineapple, reserving juice. Mix pineapple juice and dry instant vanilla pudding

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix all the dry ingredients in a medium sized plastic bag or in a bowl. Pat dry the tofu on paper towel. Place the slices or cubes inside a plastic bag and gently shake to coat tofu with the dry mixture. Place on a greased baking sheet. Lightly spray tofu with cooking oil spray. Place in oven and bake for approximately 25-30 minutes until golden brown. Serve with your favorite dip.
In a large bowl beat the eggs, milk, and salt. Dip bread in batter. Fry in a frying pan with butter. Add powdered sugar on top. Add the juice of an orange on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Butter 9 inch fluted or plain tube pan. In large bowl of electric mixer, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, eggnog, and vanilla. Stir together flour, bakng powder, and salt. Gradually beat into butter mixture. Prepare topping by combining nuts, sugar and cinnamon. Scatter half the topping evenly over bottom of pan. Spoon in half batter. Add remaining topping and spoon on remaining batter. Bake 50 to 60 minute, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, combine all dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat egg. Using one hand for the wet and the other for the dry, dredge the turkey in the egg followed by the flour mixture. Repeat until all strips are coated. Drizzle about a tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place turkey strips in skillet, cook for 3-4 minutes. Flip strips, cook an additional 3-4 minutes until cooked through, taking care to not overcook or the turkey will become incredibly dry.

Combine all of the ingredients, except the water, together in a blender. Cover and blend on low speed for 3 minutes. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie pan. Let stand about 5 minutes then sprinkle with coconut. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Serve warm or cool.

In 4-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in butter 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Stir in broth, broccoli and corn. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Stir in half-and-half. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot.

Heat oil in a large fry pan, add the vegetables and garlic, salt and pepper to taste. Saute to desired doneness. Add tomato sauce, and simmer for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley you can serve this on rice, or as a side dish, hot or cold or luke warm. You can put this on a ham sandwich. Yummm. You can put this in an omelette and top with mozzarella and parmesan. You can put this

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Pour melted butter into a 9x13-in baking dish. Add chicken, skin side down, sprinkle with seasoning salt and garlic. Turn chicken over, season and lay bacon strips on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove chicken, bacon and mushrooms to a platter and keep warm. Pour juices from baking dish into a small saucepan and whisk together with cream over low heat until thickened. Pour sauce over chicken and serve warm.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain and allow to cool. Slice cooled potatoes and layer in a large bowl or dish. In a saucepan combine water, vinegar and sugar. Bring to a boil and cook for one minute. Remove from heat and pour over potatoes. Cover and chill for at least 12 hours. Drain excess marinade and add onions, eggs, salt, pepper, celery seed and mayonnaise. Mix well and serve chilled.

Preheat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add vegetable oil or spray to coat pan. Add zucchini, summer squash, and red pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, for 3 to 4 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add italian seasoning and garlic powder. Cook 1 minute more- serve hot.

In a small mixing bowl, thoroughly mix sour cream and flour. Heat butter in a small skillet over medium-high heat. As soon as the foam disappears from the melted butter, break eggs one by one into the hot butter. Add salt and pepper to taste. When eggs begin to solidify, gently spoon sour cream over them, cover, and let cook another half minute to a minute, depending on personal preference. With spatula, transfer eggs to a warm serving plate.

Cook pasta according to pkg instructions. Meanwhile, heat oil in lg skillet or dutch oven. Add garlic. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add mushrooms, onion, lean bacon, evaporated milk, sun-dried tomatoes, light sour cream, parmesan cheese, black pepper, cooked pastapreparation:Cook pasta according to pkg instructions. Add mushrooms, onion, lean bacon, evaporated

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly coat 12 well muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray. In bowl, combine muffin mix, buttermilk, egg and 2 tbsp butter until blended. Gently fold in the blueberries and pecans. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Brush tops with 1 tbsp butter. Bake 12 minutes or till golden brown. Let cool 5 minutes, remove from pan.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Stir together oil & garlic, then using a pastry brush, brush one side of each bread slice with the oil mixture. Place bread slices on a baking sheet & bake about 10 minutes or until tops of bread slices are golden brown. Meanwhile, in medium bowl, toss together eggs, apple, walnuts & salad dressing. Top each toasted bread slice with some of the peaches, roma tomatoes, garlic clove, red wine vinegar, fresh basil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, baguette. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add eggs, water, flour, salt, pepper, cheese, olive oil and cook for about 5 minutes, until the omelette is set and the bottom is golden brown. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes longer, until the omelette is set and the bottom is golden brown. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes longer, until the omelette is set and the

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the oil and saute the onion until golden, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic ands rice and stir until coated with oil. Stir in the broth, lemon juice, split peas, cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then turn the heat down to a simmer. Cover and cook 45-50 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice and peas are tender. Let stand, covered 10 minutes, then serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, mix together soup, onion, milk, garlic, salt and pepper. Stir, in potatoes and kielbasa. Spoon into a 7x11 inch casserole dish. Place casserole on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 90 minutes or until potatoes are tender and flavors blended.

Preheat oven to 425. Cut cooked potatoes in half and scoop out the insides, leaving the shell intact. Combine the potato with remaining ingredients, except extra cheese. Mash and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Fill potato skins with mixture and top with the extra cheese. Bake at 425 until cheese melts and is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees c. In a small bowl sift together flour and baking soda, set aside. In a large bowl, combine butter and both sugars. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Reduce speed to low, add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Beat until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop heaping spoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto baking trays lined with parchment paper. Bake until golden around the edges and soft in the middle, about 8-10 minutes.

Heat oven to 180deg. Place ham on baking tray and roast for 30 mins, allow ham to cool and then squeeze out the flesh and mash in a small bowl. Add the olive oil, balsamic vinegar and dijon mustard and whish well together. Season with salt and pepper. Chop bacon into bite sized pieces, then grill or dry fry for 3-5 mins or until crisp. Place salad leaves into bowl and add bacon, onion, tomato and avocado. Toss well. Whisk the dressing ingredients again to ensure they are mixed well and then pour over salad.

In a large pot, bring stock to a boil. Add all the vegetables, mix in the vinaigrette along with salt and pepper to taste. Combine with the lettuce leaves, fat-free cottage cheese, spring onions, celery, radish, dried dill, salt & freshly ground black pepper, plum tomato, cucumbers. Combine with the lettuce leaves,

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

In a medium bowl, combine all dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat egg. Using one hand for the wet and the other for the dry, dredge the turkey in the egg followed by the flour mixture. Repeat until all strips are coated. Drizzle about a tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place turkey strips in skillet, cook for 3-4 minutes. Flip strips, cook an additional 3-4 minutes until cooked through, taking care to not overcook or the turkey will become incredibly dry.

Heat butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 5-8 minutes. Add the cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, until light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add the stock, milk, nutmeg, and pepper and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the cauliflower is easily pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Remove 1 cup of cauliflower florets and set aside., puree soup in blender or food processor until smooth. Return soup to pot and stir in the cheese and remaining cauliflower florets and adjust seasonings to taste.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and saut√© for about 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook for another 5 minutes. Add

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat together sugar, oil, eggs, and pumpkin. Stir in flour mixture alternately with water. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. For best flavor, store wrapped in plastic wrap at room temperature for a full day before serving.

In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup cream and coffee. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl, combine chocolates. Through a fine-mesh strainer, strain cream mixture over chocolates. Stir until chocolates are melted. In a medium bowl, beat remaining 2 cups cream and vanilla at high speed with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream mixture into chocolate mixture. Cover and chill. Chilling can take up to 4 hours.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Layer the first 4 ingredients in a large casserole. Lightly mix. Spread mashed potatoes evenly over the top. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over and sprinkle the pepper over the cheese. Bake on middle oven rack for approximately 45 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Alternately place in 4 to 6 small single serving casseroles. Either way these casseroles freeze well.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a pan large enough to hold the chops in a single layer with non-stick spray. Season the pork steaks or chops with salt& pepper. Arrange them in single layer in the prepared pan. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the chops from the pan and pour off the fat. Place the apples in the pan and top with the baked chops. Bake uncovered, basting occasionally, for 45 minutes or until pork is tender.

Preheat oven to 400f line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Coat a small saucepan with non-stick cooking spray. Over medium heat, cook and stir garlic until soft, about 3 minutes. Mix in white wine, honey, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Simmer, uncovered, for about 3 minutes, or until flesh flakes easily with a fork. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 14 minutes, or until flesh flakes easily with a fork. Brush fillets with remaining glaze, and season with salt and pepper. Use a spatula to transfer fillets to serving platter, leaving the skin behind on the foil. Bake in preheated oven

In a large mixing bowl, cream the marshmallows until smooth. Add in the cream and vanilla. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the marshmallows and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

In a large saucepan over low heat stir together first three ingredients. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil and boil 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cereal, toss and coat with cooked mixture until coated well. Quickly press into pan. Cool, then cut into squares.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and saut√© for about 5 minutes. Add the butter and saut√© for another 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook for another 5 minutes. Add

Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process just until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful not to overprocess. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months. To make cozy hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly. Serve immediately.

Combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, fat-free mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes are tender. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.

Place the tofu on a plate and pat dry with kitchen paper. Slice into 1cm thick slices. Heat the silken tofu in a non stick frying pan, once oil is hot add the tofu and cook over a medium heat for 5-8minutes either side or until tofu is golden brown. Place the soy sauce, sesame oil, 5 spice powder and honey in a large bowl. Mix well and toss. In the warm tofu. Sprinkle over the sesame seeds. Serve with steamed tender stem broccoli or stir fried vegetables.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

In a small saucepan, melt butter and chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly until melted. Stir in sugar, vanilla, salt, and milk. Bring to a boil over medium-low heat. Cook 7 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve warm over ice cream or pound cake. The amount of time will vary with the amount of sauce being reheated.

Cream butter in a bowl. Add sugar in the butter and mix well. Gradually add beaten eggs and stir well. Sift flour, baking powder, and green tea powder together and add the flour to the egg mixture. Pour the batter into a buttered loaf pan. Bake in preheated 340 degrees f oven for about 30-40 minutes.

In a large, heavy bottomed, skillet place the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the almonds and cook, stirring constantly, until almost all the water has evaporated. About 5 minutes. Add the cinnamon and salt and cook until the sugar has dried on the almonds. About 2 minutes. Pour onto a large sheet pan and let cool.

Heat grill to high, rub mushrooms with oil. Grill for 3 minutes each side or till cooked but still firm. Mix cheese, garlic, butter, salt and pepper together in a bowl. Spoon mixture into mushrooms. Grill until cheese melts. Place in toasted buns with salad. This could also be done in the oven.

Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Season steaks generously on both side with salt and pepper. Place steaks in skillet. Cook, turning once, until browned, 2-3 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer to a warmed plate, cover with foil. Add vinegar to skillet. Boil until syrupy, scraping to loosen browned bits from skillet. Whisk in mustard and any accumulated juices from steak. Serve steaks with sauce.

Melt butter in a saucepan. Add mushrooms, onion and garlic. Saute until golden, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth, tomato paste and black pepper. Bring to the boiling point. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Blend cornstarch with water. Mix some of the hot mushroom sauce into cornstarch mixture and return to saucepan. Cook and stir until golden brown and butter has been absorbed. Add lemon mixture to mushrooms, onion and garlic

Place chicken in crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 8-9 hours. Remove chicken and cool slightly. Skim fat from cooking juices. Remove chicken from bones and cut into bite-size pieces and return to crockpot. Serve with a slotted spoon on buns. I have also used boneless skinless chicken pieces and cut them up before placing in the crockpot. You just need to adjust cooking time if doing it this way.
Place ice cubes in a large bowl. Add lemon juice, water and sugar. Mix well. Chill. Garnish with lemon slices.

In a wok or frying pan heat 2 tbsp oil. Add onions and garlic. Saut until onions are tender. Add rice, soy sauce, eggs, teriyaki sauce and ham. Let sit 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally. The less you stir it the more crunchiness there will be. Add peas, cover and let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.

In large pot, combine potatoes with enough salted water to cover. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well, then return potatoes to the pot. Add the butter, milk and salt and mash well. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Heat oven to 400f. Spray cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray or lightly grease. Combine biscuits, butter, italian seasoning, garlic and italian seasoning in medium mixing bowl. Add milk. Stir until soft dough forms. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake at 450f for 7 to 9 minutes or until golden brown.
In a large pot of boiling water, heat through, stirring occasionally.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie

Preheat oven to 350 deg. In saucepan, combine raspberries and cornstarch. Cook and stir until thickened. In bowl, beat egg yolk. Stir in sweetened condensed milk, realemon juice and food coloring if desired. Pour over crust. Bake 8 minutes. Spoon raspberry mixture over top. Chill 4 hours. Spread with whipped topping. Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

Melt chocolate in microwave on med. Power. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add sugar, beating until well blended. Add melted chocolate and vanilla, mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Roll into 1 inch balls. Roll in nuts or coconut. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, sour cream, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, vanilla extract, lemon juice. Add to the creamed mixture. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the beef shin in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Fry until onion and garlic are slightly turning gold. Add the chillies and continue frying. Keep stirring the whole time to avoid burning on the bottom of pan. When the onions and garlic look golden, but not browned, add chilli powder, turmeric and tuna. Stir the ingredients well for about 1 minute or so. Lower the heat to the lowest it can go. Now add the cabbage to the rest of the ingredients in the pot and gently stir around until the cabbage is fully coated with the rest of the ingredients. Place a lid on the pot and let it cook for about 30 minutes taste and see if the cabbage is cooked after 30 minutes. If not, leave it for another 5 min or so until you think its cooked. Goes well with rice or naan, or just as a side dish.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place salmon on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until salmon is golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400. Over medium heat melt butter then blend in flour, salt and pepper. Slowly mix in milk, stirring continually until mixture is thick and bubbly. Remove from heat- set aside. Line bottom and sides of a greased 9 inch pie plate with half the potatoes. Into the shell layer eggs, bacon, parsley, cheese and white sauce. Cover with remaining potatoes. Brush the top of the pie with 2 tablespoons of milk. Bake for 20 minutes or until top is browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium bowl mix sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper, honey, oil. Add pecans and toss well. Drizzle honey and oil over spiced nuts and mix well so they are evenly coated. Spread on greased baking sheet and bake 7 - 10 minutes until sugar is caramelized. Let it cool for 5 minutes and take it of the sheet otherwise they might stick to the bottom. If that happens put it back in oven to melt the sticky sugar.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, melt butter and olive oil together. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet. Stir until potatoes are evenly coated with spice mixture and onion slices are evenly distributed. Cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes, tossing and turning the potatoes every few minutes. Potatoes will be done when slightly browned and fork-tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a second bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add lemon rind and egg. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes at 170 degrees celsius.

Combine egg noodles, cream of mushroom soup, chicken broth, dry sherry, cooked chicken, sharp cheddar cheese, slivered almonds, chopped pimiento, sliced mushrooms, salt and pepper. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in the sour cream, chicken and mushrooms. Add the cooked noodles. Put in greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with buttered crumbs. Bake at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes or until it bubbles.

Preheat oven to 400f. Coat 12 cup muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray. Mix carrot, egg, cheese, and chives. Add flour and baking powder, stir. Spoon batter equally among muffin cups. Bake 25-30 minutes until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375f. Butter a round, 2-quart baking dish and pour in the fruit. Mix the farina, sugar, baking powder and salt together in a medium bowl. Beat the egg with the vanilla and add it to the farina mixture. Mix well with a fork or finger. Sprinkle the topping evenly over the fruit and pour the butter evenly over it. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until the top is lightly brown. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel, core and slice apples. Place in a well greased 8x8-inch baking pan. Mix cake mix, oats, sugar and cinnamon in a large bowl. Melt butter and pour over the top of the dry cake mixture and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle topping over filling. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until fruit is tender and topping is golden. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream if desired.

Place beef on top of vegetables. Mix corn starch with 2 t cold water and then add to juices. Bring to a boil while stirring constantly until thickened. Remove 2 cups of juices from crock pot and put into small sauce pan. Remove 2 cups of juices from crock

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the bottom of each brussels sprout off and then slice in half lengthwise. Toss all ingredients and place in a single layer on a baking dish. Roast for 25 minutes or until brussels sprouts are slightly browned and tender throughout. Serve hot or cold.

In a small saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium heat. Saute onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add curry, cumin and cayenne, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Add chicken broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to boiling point. Cover pan, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork, season with salt if needed, and serve hot.

In 13x9-inch pan, layer the cubes of cake, packing them tightly together. Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Fold in cool whip. Spread over the cake cubes in pan. Spread pie filling over top of cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle with nuts, if desired. Refrigerate until serving.

Heat 2 teaspoons of oil over high heat and add 4 rashers of butter and cook for 2-3 minutes or until crip and then set aside. Heat another 2 teaspoons of oil in the pan and add chopped brown onion and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes, 2 sprigs thyme, chicken stock and water and bring to the boil and then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Blend until smooth and stir through cream. Divide into serving bowls and top with crispy bacon to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl until well-blended. Roll peanut butter mixture into tablespoon size balls. Bake 12 minutes for chewy cookies. Bake 15 minutes for crisp.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Remove the casserole dish from the oven and place it on a wire rack in the center of the casserole dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is completely melted.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Mix all ingredients in lg bowl. Mix well. Pour into crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with pecans if desired.

Heat butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook over low heat until soft. Add garlic and cook for a further 30 seconds. Add curry paste cook for 30 seconds. Add stock. Simmer for 15 minutes. Cool slightly before pureeing. Return to the heat and stir in the yoghurt. Serve drizzled with cream and with pappadums.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 13x9x2 inch pan. Unroll dough. Press in bottom and 1 inch up sides of greased pan. Fold the 1 inch of dough over and around the cheese. Press dough edges to seal. Brush edge with melted butter and parmesan cheese. Top the crust with sauce, pepperoni and cheese. Bake at 425 degrees fahrenheit for 15 to 18 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.

In a large skillet, saute the chicken in oil until no longer pink. Stir in the soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stin in sour cream. Serve over toasted english muffins. Can also serve over cooked noodles. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper or paprika.

Heat oil in a five to six quart pot over moderately high heat. Add garlic and pepper flake, saute until golden. Be careful not to burn the garlic. Stir in tomatoes and salt. Simmer uncovered for 35 minutes. Serve over hot pasta.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Sear the stew meat in the oil for 2 minutes. Pour meat into bowl and combine chili powder, cumin and flour. Mix with the meat until evenly coated. Pour in broth. Add salt and ground black pepper pour into crock pot, add garlic put on high for an hour then reduce to low for six to seven hours stirring occasionally.

In a cocktail shaker, place the twelve mint leaves, 6 pieces of lime and the simple syrup. With a muddler, mash up the lime pieces and mint leaves so that they release their flavors and oils. Taste for sweetness and adjust if necessary. Add the rum and a handful of ice. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds or until ice crystals form. With a cocktail strainer, pour into a tall ice-filled glass. Top off with club soda. Garnish edge of glass with a slice of lime.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the filipino rice in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari.

Combine the coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together the salad dressing, vegetable oil, sugar substitute, vinegar, and salt in a medium bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour dressing mixture over coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Chill at least 2 hours before serving.

Place 1 tbsp butter into skillet to melt. Add potatoes and pepper. After 5 minutes, add onion. Brown potatoes. Onion should be limp, but not browned. In separate bowl, beat eggs, then add milk, salmon and dill. Add 2 tbsp butter to skillet to melt. Pour in egg mixture over potatoes. Scramble until almost done. Remove from heat. Eggs should still be a little moist. Sprinkle parsley on top as garnish.
Put the raspberries in a large bowl and add the ice cubes. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve immediately.

Combine the avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape tomatoes, mango, avocado, lentils, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper, grape

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix all dry ingredients in large bowl. Combine wet ingredients in a bowl. Mix dry and wet ingredients together. Pour into prepared muffin pans and bake at 375 for 20 to 25 minutes.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Preheat oven to 350f. Toss together berries and apples, spread evenly over bottom of 8x8 baking dish. In medium bowl combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and oats. Using pastry cutter work butter into oat mixture until crumbly. Spread over fruit, pressing down lightly. Bake 40-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Cool before serving. Top with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Beat butter, sugar, baking powder, and vanilla in a large bowl with mixer on high 3 minutes or until fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. On low speed, beat in flour in 3 additions alternately with milk in 2 additions, just until blended, scraping sides of bowl as needed. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans on a wire rack for 10 minutes.

In a saucepan over low heat, bring the sparkling summer tea to a boil. Simmer until the tea is soft. Add the rest of the water. Bring to a boil again and remove from heat. Mix the cornstarch and a bit of water separately. Add to the saucepan and let simmer for a few minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Serve with a bit of granulated sugar sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Whisk together the tuna and asparagus in a roasting pan and place in the oven. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until the tuna is shrivelled. Spread the tuna in a roasting pan and place in the oven. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until the asparagus is tender. Break the ends from the asparagus at their natural breaking point. Add the tender lengths of asparagus to the tomatoes and continue to cook for 25 minutes or until the asparagus is tender.

Heat large non-stick skillet, swirl in oil, then add garlic. Saute 30 seconds. Add beef in two batches, cook til just browned, about 2 minutes. Drain pasta, add to bowl with yogurt dressing. Add steak and tomatoes, toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Cook broccoli, onion, garlic and carrot in oil about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until broccoli is crisp- tender. Stir in chicken, salt, and tomatoes. Cook about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, just until chicken is hot. Toss with pasta. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine cornbread-muffin mix, milk, eggs, deli ham, cheddar cheese and half of the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top of casserole. Dot with butter. Bake for additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut chicken in half. Arrange, skin side up, in a roasting pan. Combine butter, lemon juice, and spices in a small bowl and mix well. Brush chicken with mixture. Roast until juices run clear. Broil 6 inches from heat for 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Place linguine in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over linguine. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion.

Sprinkle salt and pepper over the lamb, and cook for about 5-7 minutes, without adding any water, drain very well and chop roughly. When the lamb had its cooking time, add the lamb to the marinade and coat well on all sides. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Place lamb in a extra large heavy-duty plastic bag or glass bowl. Pour the marinade over the lamb, and turn to coat well on all sides. Cover

In a large non-stick pan, cook vegetables on medium heat covered for about 3 minutes. Mix 1 packet of seasoning with water. Add water, ramen and crab to veggies and stir continuously until noodles are soft and most of water is absorbed. Pour over marinade. Heat through and serve.

In a 3 quart saucepan, melt butter and saute onions. Add potatoes, water, and bouillon cubes. Cover and bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium. Cook just until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, place frozen broccoli and cheddar cheese in crock pot on low to start melting and thawing. Once the potatoes are done, using a hand blender, blend contents of saucepan to desired consistency and then pour into the crock pot. Heat on low until warmed.

Muddle pomegranate leaves, 1 lime wedge and simple syrup. Add ice, rum and pomegranate juice. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds or until ice crystals form. With a cocktail strainer, pour into a tall ice-filled glass. Top off with club soda. Garnish edge of glass with a slice of lime.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine oil, rosemary, garlic cloves, salt and pepper in large bowl. Add potato wedges and shake or toss to coat. Arrange skin-side-down in oiled pan. Bake 35-40 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to form a roux, cooking until bubbly. Whisk in 1 jar of clam juice, until smooth. Pour in half-and-half, and rest of clam juice, stirring constantly. Stir in clams, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Season with pepper and serve.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. Add the catsup and sugar and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the parsley and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the garlic and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the parsley and

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat together sugar, oil, eggs, and pumpkin. Stir in flour mixture alternately with water. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. For best flavor, store wrapped in plastic wrap at room temperature for a full day before serving.

Heat 1 tbs oil in a saucepan and fry onion and garlic for approx 2 minute, making sure not to brown the paste. Add hot water. Wash the lentils and put into the water. Add salt and tsp of turmeric. Bring to boil then lower heat and cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring once or twice. Heat oil in another saucepan and fry onion till golden, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with italian crusty bread or flatbreads.
